page.title: 16SPORT IN NEWICK
page.content: The first record of a cricket match in Newick is 10th.May 1722 when they lost to Hurst. The present Cricket Club has been in existence since 1884, playing first on the Green, then on the old workhouse field and more recently on a playing field near Church Rd. Cricket became a great tradition in Newick, its most famous cricketers being James and John Langridge who played for Sussex, and James for England. Cricket weeks became the fashion, and the visiting Australian Test team always played their first game here. Other thriving sports are football, stoolball (a uniquely Sussex game), badminton, bowls, tennis and rugby. Many other activities are organised in Newick such as amateur dramatics,horse shows, two W.I.groups, brownies, cubs, guides and scouts, Darby and Joan, a horticultural club, and many more.
